Annotation Interface ColumnDefinition

@Retention(SOURCE) @Target({}) public @interface ColumnDefinition
Defines a column in the generated Excel file, including its field source, display name, styles, and formula. This annotation is used within ExportToExcel to configure individual columns.

  • Required Element Summary

    Required Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Required Element
    Description
    String
    fieldName
    The name of the field in the source class to extract data from.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    ExcelStyle
    bodyStyle
    The style to apply to the column data cells.
    String
    columnName
    The display name of the column in the Excel file.
    ExcelFormula
    formula
    The formula to apply to the column, if any.
    ExcelStyle
    headerStyle
    The style to apply to the column header.
    int
    order
    The order of the column in the Excel file.
    ColumnType
    type
    The data type of the column to control formatting in the Excel file.

  • Element Details

    • fieldName

      String fieldName
      The name of the field in the source class to extract data from. Supports nested fields (e.g., "a.name").
      Returns:
      the field name or nested field path

    • columnName

      String columnName
      The display name of the column in the Excel file. If empty, defaults to the field name.
      Returns:
      the column name
      Default:
      ""

    • headerStyle

      ExcelStyle headerStyle
      The style to apply to the column header.
      Returns:
      the header style configuration
      Default:
      @ir.byteplus.expogen.ExcelStyle

    • bodyStyle

      ExcelStyle bodyStyle
      The style to apply to the column data cells.
      Returns:
      the body style configuration
      Default:
      @ir.byteplus.expogen.ExcelStyle

    • order

      int order
      The order of the column in the Excel file. Columns are sorted by this value in ascending order.
      Returns:
      the column order
      Default:
      0

    • formula

      ExcelFormula formula
      The formula to apply to the column, if any.
      Returns:
      the formula configuration
      Default:
      @ir.byteplus.expogen.ExcelFormula

    • type

      ColumnType type
      The data type of the column to control formatting in the Excel file.
      Returns:
      the column type (e.g., STRING, NUMBER, DATE, BOOLEAN)
      Default:
      STRING
